definitions.definition: great respect for somebody

examples.text: the **guest of honor** *(= the most important one)*
the **seat/place of honor** *(= given to the most important guest)*
They stood in silence as a mark of honor to her.
This biography does great honor to the poet's achievements.

definitions.definition: something that you are very pleased or proud to do because people are showing you great respect

examples.text: It was a great honor to be invited here today.
It was my honor and privilege to be Helen's friend.
It is a great honor to represent my country at the Olympics.

definitions.definition: the quality of knowing and doing what is morally right

examples.text: a man of honor
a sense of honor
Proving his innocence has become a matter of honor.

definitions.definition: a good reputation; respect from other people

examples.text: upholding the honor of your country
The family honor is at stake.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that causes others to respect and admire something/somebody

examples.text: She is an honor to the profession.

definitions.definition: an award, official title, etc. given to somebody as a reward for something that they have done

examples.text: to win the highest honor
She received nearly every honor bestowed upon a poet.
He was buried **with full military honors** *(= with a special military service as a sign of respect)*.
He wears his scars like **badges of honor** *(= rewards that you can see)*.

definitions.definition: a university course that is of a higher level than a basic course (in the US also used to describe a class in school that is at a higher level than other classes)

examples.text: an **honors degree/course**
a First Class Honors degree
I took an honors class in English.

definitions.definition: if you pass an exam or graduate from a university or school with honors, you receive a special grade for having achieved a very high standard
a title of respect used when talking to or about a judge or a US mayor

examples.text: No more questions, Your Honor.

definitions.definition: the cards that have the highest value
to do something to make somebody feel very proud and pleased

examples.text: Would you do me the honor of dining with me?

definitions.definition: to perform a social duty or ceremony, such as pouring drinks, making a speech, etc.

examples.text: Would you do the honors and draw the winning ticket?

definitions.definition: to be given the opportunity to do something that makes you feel proud and happy

examples.text: May I have the honor of the next dance?
She had the honor of being the first living artist to have her work exhibited in the Louvre.
I had the rare honor of being allowed into the artist's studio.
Max was given the dubious honor *(= it may not really have made him feel proud and happy)* of organizing the children's party.

definitions.definition: used to say that even criminals have standards of behaviour that they respect
to feel that you must do something because of your sense of moral duty

examples.text: He felt honor-bound to help her.

definitions.definition: no particular person, team, etc. is doing better than the others in a competition, an argument, etc.
in order to show great respect for somebody/something

examples.text: a ceremony in honor of those killed in the explosion
A banquet was held in her honor.

definitions.definition: used to promise very seriously that you will do something or that something is true

examples.text: I swear on my honor that I knew nothing about this.

definitions.definition: to be trusted to do something

examples.text: You're on your honor not to go into my room.

definitions.definition: a thing that somebody considers to be very important for their honour or reputation
